article:
A 'cell' in the context of electronic design automation (EDA) is an abstract
representation of a component within a schematic diagram or physical layout of
an electronic circuit in software.

A cell-based design methodology is a technique that enables designers to analyze
chip designs at varying levels of abstraction. For example, one designer may
focus on the logical function (high-level) and another may concentrate on
physical implementation (low-level). The technique also enables designers to
reuse components in more complex designs without understanding all of the
implementation details.
